intro: Epilobium glanduligerum, commonly known as sticky willow or glandular willow, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, sticky hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and feature five petals with a distinctive pink or reddish hue. Epilobium glanduligerum is often found in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows.
